/work/doc/pages/SbeMessage.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup sbe-protocol-message SBE Message
2 \ingroup getting-started
3 
4 \details
5 
6 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::SbeMessage represents a Simple Binary Encoding (SBE) message.
7 The details about SBE can be found in the ["Binary Order Entry - Message Specification Guidelines"] document.
8 
9 \section message-class MessageHolder class
10 
11 The Handler exposes the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder class to encapsulate services related to handling SBE
12 messages.
13 It is a template class, which creates an underlying buffer to store an SBE message.
14 
15 The template parameter `SbeMessageType` serves to indicate how the underlying buffer will be interpreted and what type
16 of SBE message it will store.
17 
18 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder class contains the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::SimpleOpenFramingHeader and a
19 strongly typed SBE message over the underlying data buffer.
20 
21 To access to the strongly typed SBE message, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder::message method or
22 OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder::operator->().
23 
24 \section strongly-typed-sbe-message-wrappers Strongly Typed SBE Message Wrappers
25 
26 The Handler exposes strongly typed SBE message wrappers (e.g.: `OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::NewOrderSingle102`), which
27 provide interfaces to manipulate SBE message fields.
28 These wrappers are used in strongly typed inbound callbacks of the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener class
29 (e.g.: OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onExecutionReportNew(const Messaging::ExecutionReportNew200 &, Session *)).
30 
31 \note Strongly typed SBE message wrapper classes do not have an underlying buffer and work only over an external buffer.
32 Therefore, one needs to make sure that the lifetime of a strongly typed SBE message class object is the same as the
33 lifetime of the buffer.
34 For example, one should not use the delivered strongly typed SBE message object outside the inbound callback, since it
35 uses an internal receiving buffer.
36 
37 \section construct-sbe-message Constructing SBE Message
38 
39 To create an SBE message object, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder constructor. It
40 creates the underlying buffer and the strongly typed message wrapper around it.
41 
42 For example:
43 
44 The following example demonstrates how SBE messages can be created.
45 \snippet SbeMessage.cpp messageCreating
46 
47 \note By default, the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::MessageHolder constructor sets optional fields to their `null` values,
48 required field values are **undefined**.
49 This behavior could be changed using the OnixS::B3::BOE::Messaging::FieldsNoInitPolicy template argument.
50 
51 For example:
52 
53 \snippet SbeMessage.cpp messageCreationWithoutFieldsInitialization
54
